item.title: Who cut the plant-based cheese? Plonts did with microbes, and it’s stinky
item.dc:creator: Christine Hall
item.description:
Plonts’ cheese is made from soybeans, one of the most efficient ways to grow protein. Soybeans themselves are not very flavorful, and that is where fermentation and aging, help Plonts to create flavor versus using natural flavors.

item.title: Hyperspace is building custom instances to accelerate database searches
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Hyperspace, a Tel Aviv-based startup, says its custom cloud instances for database searches can dramatically speed up queries.

item.title: AI-powered water heater could banish cold showers and carbon pollution
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Cala Systems’ water heater pairs an advanced heat pump with an AI-powered control system to forecast hot water demand.

item.title: Perspective Space emerges from stealth with plans to improve space weather predictions
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Rocket launch providers, satellite operators, and even aviation companies rely on accurate predictions about “space weather,” like solar flares and geomagnetic storms, to inform their operations. But this vital information is still supplied mainly by governments using inaccurate, older modeling techniques.  Perspective Space, a Canadian startup that emerged from stealth on Tuesday, is looking to […]

item.title: PayPal makes quick guest-checkout solution Fastlane available to U.S. businesses
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
PayPal said on Tuesday that it is making its quick guest-checkout solution, Fastlane, available to all U.S. merchants after testing it with select businesses for a few months. Businesses will initially have to use the company’s payment processing services, such as PayPal Braintree or PayPal Complete Payments, to use Fastlane. The company first started testing […]

item.title: Amazon’s India chief resigns amid intensifying competition
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Manish Tiwary, the head of Amazon’s India operations, is leaving the firm as the U.S. e-commerce giant grapples with mounting pressure from competitors in one of its crucial international markets. Tiwary, who took over as country manager in late 2020, is departing as Amazon has noticeably shifted its focus on cloud business in India and […]

item.title: Uber highlights autonomous vehicle efforts now that Tesla’s in its rearview mirror
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Uber is highlighting the success of its autonomous vehicle effort — likely to assuage investors concerned about incoming competition from Tesla.

item.title: German computer scientists raise $30 million to help companies make sense of their data
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
It’s not easy for organizations to become data-driven, despite the aspirations many have to get there. Even orgs with data analytics teams often struggle to make effective use of their data. According to a recent Gartner survey, fewer than half of data and analytics leaders say their teams are effective in providing value to their […]

item.title: Figure’s new humanoid robot leverages OpenAI for natural speech conversations
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Figure 02 is outfitted with speakers and microphones to speak and listen to people at work.

item.title: H3X scales up its electric aerospace ambitions with $20M in new funding
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Many industries that rely on legacy energy sources are aiming to electrify or at least streamline their operations, but for countless use cases the tech just isn’t there. H3X is changing the game with electric motors so compact and efficient that the aerospace and marine world — not to mention investors — are taking notice. […]

item.title: GrubMarket has acquired Good Eggs

item.title: OpenAI co-founder Schulman leaves for Anthropic, Brockman takes extended leave
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
John Schulman, one of the co-founders of OpenAI, has left the company for rival AI startup Anthropic. In addition, OpenAI president and co-founder Greg Brockman is taking an extended leave — through the end of the year — after nine years at the company to “relax and recharge,” the company confirmed. Peter Deng, a product […]

item.title: Secretaries of state urge X to stop its Grok chatbot from spreading election misinformation
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Grok — not to be confused with the homophonic AI startup Groq that this morning raised over $600 million — has been spreading false information about Vice President Kamala Harris on X, the social network formerly known as Twitter. That’s according to an open letter penned by five secretaries of state and addressed to Tesla, […]

item.title: Lucid pumps $1.5B from Saudi wealth fund after CEO warned relying on its ‘bottomless wealth’ was ‘dangerous’
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Saudi Arabia is committing even more money to Lucid Motors as the EV startup struggles to erase its losses. Lucid announced Monday as part of its second-quarter earnings report that an affiliate of the Saudi sovereign wealth fund is committing another $1.5 billion, with half coming in the form of a private placement and the […]

item.title: TechCrunch Space: I’m tired of talking about Starliner, too

item.description:

item.title: Google loses massive antitrust case over search, will appeal ruling
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Google will appeal a U.S. District Court judge’s opinion Monday that found the technology giant acted illegally to maintain a monopoly in online search. The decision from Judge Amit P. Mehta of the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia is a major defeat for Google that could alter the way it does business […]

item.description:
